alert.note: Alert for Northern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:42AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern New Haven County through 945 AM EDT... At 841 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Farmington to Prospect to near Monroe. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waterbury, Meriden, Wallingford, Naugatuck, Southbury, Wolcott, Hamden, Cheshire, Seymour, Prospect, Woodbridge, Middlebury, Beacon Falls, Bethany and Ansonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southern Connecticut.
